results.question: What are Core Web Vitals?
results.correct_answer: Subset of Web Vitals metrics focusing on user experience aspects like loading, interactivity, and visual stability.
incorrect_answers: A set of metrics used to measure server performance.
A new JavaScript framework developed by Google.
A subset of Google's ranking algorithm.

results.question: Which aspects of user experience do Core Web Vitals focus on?
results.correct_answer: Loading, interactivity, and visual stability.
incorrect_answers: Server response time, content quality, and conversion rate.

results.question: What does Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) measure?
results.correct_answer: Loading performance of the page by measuring the time to show the largest element within the viewport.
incorrect_answers: Time taken for the browser to process user interactions.
Time taken for layout calculations to complete.
Time taken to display the first meaningful content on the page.

results.question: What does First Input Delay (FID) measure?
results.correct_answer: Time from user interaction to the browser processing event handlers.
incorrect_answers: Time taken to load all external resources on the page.
Time taken for the browser to render the page.
Time taken for animations and transitions to complete.

results.question: What does Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) measure?
results.correct_answer: Overall layout stability of the site, considering elements shifting after initial render.
incorrect_answers: The time it takes for the largest element to become visible on the page.
The time it takes for a page to become interactive.
The amount of visual changes made by JavaScript animations.

results.question: What is Lighthouse?
results.correct_answer: An open-source tool for measuring web page quality and performance.
incorrect_answers: A proprietary tool developed by Google for internal use.
A JavaScript framework for building interactive web applications.
A programming language used for server-side scripting.

results.question: How does the Image component in Next.js optimize loading?
results.correct_answer: Serving correctly sized images for different devices, using modern formats.
incorrect_answers: Automatically converting images to grayscale for faster loading.
Using inline SVGs for all images.
Loading images using a single base64-encoded sprite.

results.question: What does SSR stand for in the context of Next.js optimization?
results.correct_answer: Server-Side Rendering

results.question: What is the purpose of Core Web Vitals?
results.correct_answer: To provide guidelines and metrics for creating performant websites
incorrect_answers: To create a new programming language for web development
To encourage excessive use of animations and effects

results.question: What does LCP stand for in Core Web Vitals?
results.correct_answer: Largest Contentful Paint

results.question: What does FID measure in Core Web Vitals?
results.correct_answer: Time between user interaction and browser processing
incorrect_answers: Time taken to fully load a web page
Time taken to render the first element on a page
Time taken to load external scripts and styles

results.question: What does CLS indicate in Core Web Vitals?
results.correct_answer: Layout stability of a site

results.question: How can Lighthouse be run?
results.correct_answer: In Chrome DevTools, from the command line, or as a Node module

results.question: What does the Lighthouse tool help developers with?
results.correct_answer: Identifying and improving web page metrics

results.question: What is the recommended Largest Contentful Paint (LCP) time according to Google?
results.correct_answer: 2.5 seconds or less

results.question: What is the target First Input Delay (FID) time according to Google?
results.correct_answer: 100 milliseconds or less

results.question: What is the recommended Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) score according to Google?
results.correct_answer: 0.1 or less

results.question: What is the purpose of using the <Image /> component in Next.js?
results.correct_answer: To improve performance by serving correctly sized images
incorrect_answers: To add visual effects to web pages
To improve the layout stability of a site

results.question: What does the 'priority' property in the <Image /> component do?
results.correct_answer: Marks the image as priority to preload

results.question: What is the purpose of the 'sizes' property in the <Image /> component?
results.correct_answer: To specify the image width at different breakpoints

results.question: What is the recommended approach for using remote images with the <Image /> component?
results.correct_answer: Define the remote domains in 'images.domains' in next.config.js
incorrect_answers: Use relative URLs instead of absolute URLs
Include remote images in your bundle

results.question: What is the purpose of the 'dynamic' function in Next.js?
results.correct_answer: To dynamically import external libraries and components
incorrect_answers: To create dynamic animations on web pages
To generate dynamic content for databases

results.question: What is the main advantage of dynamically importing components in Next.js?
results.correct_answer: Reduces initial bundle size and improves performance
incorrect_answers: Allows components to be used across different projects

results.question: What is the benefit of using server-side rendering (SSR) for web pages?
results.correct_answer: Reduces time to first render and improves performance
incorrect_answers: Increases the need for client-side scripting

results.question: What is the purpose of the 'getStaticProps' function in Next.js?
results.correct_answer: To pre-render static data on the server for better performance
incorrect_answers: To create dynamic animations on web pages
To fetch data from external APIs
To handle user input and form submissions

results.question: What is the final optimization discussed in the content?
results.correct_answer: Using server-side rendering (SSR) for pre-rendering
incorrect_answers: Including a large number of external libraries
Using inline styles instead of external CSS
Using animations for all UI elements
